Posts.Content: 6 sessions in of 15 Radiotherapy, everyone I have spoken to has mentioned the extreme fatigue I will experience....I’m presuming it comes towards the end of treatment, but so far I feel fine, managing to work (although short shifts as my appt is 1730) any advice would be appreciated as to when and how I should deal with it when it comes..... what should I expect? What are your experiences?
Posts.Title: Tiredness/fatigue

Posts.Content: Thank you granny 59,  its been my day off today and ive done nothing at all which is so unusual!! I think keeping busy is the way forward until, as you say it hits me x
Posts.Title: Tiredness/fatigue

Posts.Content: Thanks Doha Yogi, ive done very little today (on my day off) and actually feel worse for it!! i too have managed so far to work full time in an acute hospital setting which I think does help, although I know we can’t all be the same, ive not long started my tamoxifen so have all that brings to contend with too!! Roll on session 15....
Posts.Title: Tiredness/fatigue

Posts.Content: Thank you, your words have really hit home and what you say makes perfect sense, met a life long friend for breakfast, and she skirted round the ‘how are you’ question....
Posts.Title: Well that’s that

Posts.Content: 110 days from intitial diagnosis of breast cancer to completion of treatment, can’t fault the journey but now feel out on a limb!!! To family and friends it’s done, over and completed.... I’m cured!! Yay, I feeel the same but now battling the radiotherapy fatigue, although my husband and kids have been so supportive, I feel like they’re now saying get on with it’!! You’re finished treatment (despite me leaving the leaflets lying around) I'm knackered, physically and mentally drained (although in the grand scheme of things, extremely lucky) I know I should be grateful, but actually feel really angry at them for being so dismissive, feelinng apprehensive now as my next appointment isn’t until April 2019.... ive been so thankful to come on here and have a look around at other people’s journeys, I know mines been short but nevertheless one is never envisaged taking... all the best to each and every one of you xx
Posts.Title: Well that’s that

Posts.Content: Thank you, it’s good to know that someone understands!!
Posts.Title: Well that’s that

Posts.Content: Thank you, your words have really hit home and what you say makes perfect sense, met a life long friend for breakfast, and she skirted round the ‘how are you’ question....
Posts.Title: Well that’s that

Posts.Content: Oh how I tried to have a family dinner out, but with two kids back from uni and the third heavily involved in the Edinburgh Fringe, it hasn’t materialised... I feel like I’ve won the lottery, but lost the ticket!!  I know they care, in their own special ways x
Posts.Title: Well that’s that
